com.clover_studio.spikachatmodule.utils

Class ExtAudioRecorder

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.clover_studio.spikachatmodule.utils.ExtAudioRecorder

  • public class ExtAudioRecorder
extends java.lang.Object
    ExtAudioRecorder Records audio files.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  ExtAudioRecorder.State
      INITIALIZING : recorder is initializing; READY : recorder has been initialized, recorder not yet started RECORDING : recording ERROR : reconstruction needed STOPPED: reset needed

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static boolean RECORDING_COMPRESSED 
      static boolean RECORDING_UNCOMPRESSED 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ExtAudioRecorder(boolean uncompressed, int audioSource, int sampleRate, int channelConfig, int audioFormat)
      Default constructor Instantiates a new recorder, in case of compressed recording the parameters can be left as 0.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static ExtAudioRecorder getInstanse(java.lang.Boolean recordingCompressed) 
      int getMaxAmplitude()
      Returns the largest amplitude sampled since the last call to this method.
      ExtAudioRecorder.State getState()
      Returns the state of the recorder in a RehearsalAudioRecord.State typed object.
      void prepare()
      Prepares the recorder for recording, in case the recorder is not in the INITIALIZING state and the file path was not set the recorder is set to the ERROR state, which makes a reconstruction necessary.
      void release()
      Releases the resources associated with this class, and removes the unnecessary files, when necessary
      void reset()
      Resets the recorder to the INITIALIZING state, as if it was just created.
      void setOutputFile(java.lang.String argPath)
      Sets output file path, call directly after construction/reset.
      void start()
      Starts the recording, and sets the state to RECORDING.
      void stop()
      Stops the recording, and sets the state to STOPPED.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ExtAudioRecorder

        public ExtAudioRecorder(boolean uncompressed,
                int audioSource,
                int sampleRate,
                int channelConfig,
                int audioFormat)
        Default constructor Instantiates a new recorder, in case of compressed recording the parameters can be left as 0. In case of errors, no exception is thrown, but the state is set to ERROR

    • Method Detail

      • getInstanse

        public static ExtAudioRecorder getInstanse(java.lang.Boolean recordingCompressed)

      • getState

        public ExtAudioRecorder.State getState()
        Returns the state of the recorder in a RehearsalAudioRecord.State typed object. Useful, as no exceptions are thrown.
        Returns:
        recorder state

      • setOutputFile

        public void setOutputFile(java.lang.String argPath)
        Sets output file path, call directly after construction/reset. file path

      • getMaxAmplitude

        public int getMaxAmplitude()
        Returns the largest amplitude sampled since the last call to this method.
        Returns:
        returns the largest amplitude since the last call, or 0 when not in recording state.

      • prepare

        public void prepare()
        Prepares the recorder for recording, in case the recorder is not in the INITIALIZING state and the file path was not set the recorder is set to the ERROR state, which makes a reconstruction necessary. In case uncompressed recording is toggled, the header of the wave file is written. In case of an exception, the state is changed to ERROR

      • release

        public void release()
        Releases the resources associated with this class, and removes the unnecessary files, when necessary

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Resets the recorder to the INITIALIZING state, as if it was just created. In case the class was in RECORDING state, the recording is stopped. In case of exceptions the class is set to the ERROR state.

      • start

        public void start()
        Starts the recording, and sets the state to RECORDING. Call after prepare().

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Stops the recording, and sets the state to STOPPED. In case of further usage, a reset is needed. Also finalizes the wave file in case of uncompressed recording.
